questions.text: A 60-year-old female patient, who has been on anti-diabetic therapy for the last 10 years, has experienced three episodes of vaginal Candida infection in the past two months. Which of the following anti-diabetic drugs should be avoided in this patient? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Canagliflozin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ SGLT2 inhibitors (drugs ending in "-gliflozin" - Canagliflozin, Dapagliflozin, Empagliflozin) can increase the risk of urogenital infections, including vaginal candidiasis, due to increased glucose excretion in the urine. They should be used with caution or avoided in patients prone to such infections.
  • ➤ SGLT2 inhibitors (drugs ending in "-gliflozin" - Canagliflozin, Dapagliflozin, Empagliflozin)

questions.text: Anticancer drug that can result in hand and foot syndrome is: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Capecitabine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Capecitabine & 5FU can cause hand-foot syndrome, which is an important side effect to monitor in patients receiving this treatment.

A 52-year-old male presents with headache, confusion, visual disturbances, nausea, vomiting, and seizures. On examination, blood pressure is 220/110 mmHg. Which of the following treatments is most appropriate for managing his condition? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) IV Labetalol

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ DOC for Hypertensive emergencies:
  • ➤ DOC for Hypertensive emergencies:
  • ➤ Encephalopathy - Nicardipine or IV Labetalol Intracranial Hemorrhage - Nicardipine or Labetalol Acute Coronary Syndrome – IV Nitroglycerin Pulmonary Edema - Intravenous Nitroglycerin / Sodium Nitroprusside Aortic Dissection – Nicardipine in combination with Esmolol or Labetalol In Pregnancy - Labetalol
  • ➤ Encephalopathy - Nicardipine or IV Labetalol
  • ➤ Encephalopathy - Nicardipine or IV Labetalol
  • ➤ Encephalopathy

  • ➤ Acute Coronary Syndrome – IV Nitroglycerin

Which of the following cytokines is least likely to be involved in promoting inflammation in this patient?

questions.text: Mechanism of action of rivaroxaban is: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rivaroxaban is a direct, reversible inhibitor of Factor Xa, a key enzyme in the blood coagulation process, and is used as an anticoagulant.

Lipid envelope is found in which virus?

A man with diabetes was on medication and forgot to take his meals before going to the gym. During his workout, he collapsed, and his blood sugar level was found to be 50 mg/dL. Which of the following oral antidiabetic drugs can result in hypoglycemia when used as monotherapy? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Glimepiride

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sulfonylureas, like glimepiride, can cause hypoglycemia, especially when meals are skipped, due to their insulin-stimulating effects.

questions.text: In which of the following situations would Non Invasive Ventilation considered to be contraindicated?

options.label: D
options.text: Wait and watch till delivery of child, followed by PCNL

questions.text: Lung biopsy of a neutropenic patient shows the following organism on staining. Identify the organism:

You are seeing a 20-year-old man who complains of edema and frothy urine for 2 months. Labs reveal a normal serum creatinine and 4+ protein in urine without blood or bacteria. He undergoes a kidney biopsy, which is normal on light microscopy. Which is the best treatment for this patient?

A primigravida at 38 weeks is undergoing an ultrasound for fetal wellbeing. The following image is seen where a structure is seen below the fetal head (marked H) above the cervix as shown. What is the next best step?

A full-term newborn is assessed shortly after birth and is found to have a swelling on the head that does not cross suture lines. The swelling is soft to the touch and does not appear to be painful. What is the most likely diagnosis for this neonate's condition, and what is the recommended management?

options.label: A
options.text: Subgaleal hematoma; Immediate surgical drainage is necessary.

options.label: B
options.text: Caput succedaneum; No specific intervention required; resolves spontaneously.

options.label: C
options.text: Cephalohematoma; Monitor for complications and provide analgesics.

options.label: D
options.text: Intracranial hemorrhage; Order an urgent cranial CT scan for diagnosis.

questions.correct_answer: C. Cephalohematoma; Monitor for complications and provide analgesics.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Cephalohematoma; Monitor for complications and provide analgesics

questions.text: Which antibody is most commonly produced in secondary immune response?

A 46y woman presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and dysmenorrhea which has gradually been worsening over the past few months. On examination she is pale. Abdominal examination is normal. Bimanual examination reveals an irregularly enlarged non tender uterus of 10-12 weeks size with the lateral fornices free. What is your diagnosis?
A pole vaulter had a fall during pole vaulting and had paralysis of the arm. Which of the following investigations gives the best recovery prognosis?

A 60-year-old shipyard worker presents to the clinic with complaints of increasing shortness of breath and a persistent dry cough over the past year. He has spent the last 35 years working in shipbreaking, often dealing with insulation materials. He denies any significant past medical history, chest pain, or unintentional weight loss. Physical examination reveals diminished breath sounds bilaterally. A chest X-ray is ordered and reveals a "ground glass" appearance. Which of the following conditions is most consistent with these clinical findings?
According to European Hernia Society (EHS) classification, a primary indirect hernia with a defect permitting 4 fingers is labelled as:

A 45-year-old patient presents with complaints of dyspnea on exertion for 1 month. Echocardiography reveals mitral stenosis and left ventricular hypertrophy. The histopathological image provided shows a particular finding. Identify the histopathological finding and the probable diagnosis.
questions.correct_answer: B. Aschoff body; Rheumatic heart disease

questions.text: In an enzyme with a critical Glu residue in the active site, which of the following amino acid substitutions would be expected to have the least effect on enzyme activity?

A 50-year-old male patient with bronchial asthma is currently on inhaler therapy with ipratropium and formoterol. Despite the medication, his symptoms are not improving due to his incoordination of hand and inhaler usage. What should be the next step in management? (FMGE JULY 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Monitor plasma levels of ipratropium and formoterol

options.label: B
options.text: Use nebulizer of formoterol and ipratropium

options.label: C
options.text: Use dry powder inhaler of formoterol and ipratropium

options.label: D
options.text: Use budesonide along with formoterol and ipratropium inhaler

questions.correct_answer: B. Use nebulizer of formoterol and ipratropium
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Use nebulizer of formoterol and ipratropium

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For patients with bronchial asthma who struggle with the coordination required for using an inhaler, transitioning to a nebulizer is an effective strategy to ensure proper medication delivery and symptom control.

questions.text: A 30-year-old pregnant female is advised to take folic acid supplements. Folic acid is given in pregnancy to prevent which of the following conditions? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Neural tube defects

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Folic acid supplementation in pregnancy is essential to prevent neural tube defects, with the standard recommended dose being 400 micrograms per day, increased to 4000 micrograms for those at higher risk.

questions.text: Restriction Fragment Length Polymorphism was used in order to identify the different species of staphylococci in an ICU patient. Which of the following site does the restriction enzyme act?

A 60-year-old male with a history of smoking presents with hematuria and flank pain. Imaging reveals a mass in the left kidney, and a renal biopsy is performed. The histopathological image is shown below. What is the most likely type of renal cell carcinoma (RCC)?
A log dose-response curve (DRC) was plotted with isoprenaline alone and with isoprenaline in the presence of propranolol, as shown below. The graph shows that propranolol is a: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Competitive antagonist

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Propranolol is a competitive antagonist of isoprenaline, causing a parallel rightward shift in the dose-response curve without affecting the maximal response .
  • ➤ .

On examination she has massive splenomegaly. Lab studies show neutropenia, elevated CRP, and anemia. What is the most important differential diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. T-cell Large granular lymphocytic leukemia

questions.text: A 41-year-old man has been experiencing progressive intermittent pain and a burning sensation in his right foot for the last two months, which extends from the medial malleolus along the plantar surface to the toes, including heel pain. Symptoms worsen with prolonged standing and walking. Identify the incorrect statement about the possible anatomical implications related to his condition:

options.label: A
options.text: The tibial nerve lies posterolateral to the flexor hallucis longus tendon

options.label: B
options.text: The heel pain is due to injury to the medial plantar nerve

options.label: C
options.text: The flexor retinaculum forms the medial wall of the tarsal tunnel

options.label: D
options.text: The medial malleolus lies in front of the tunnel

questions.correct_answer: B. The heel pain is due to injury to the medial plantar nerve
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The heel pain is due to injury to the medial plantar nerve

On physical examination, there is no nystagmus noted. Audiometry shows low-frequency sensorineural hearing loss in the left ear. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Administration of IV fluids at a minimum of 3000 mL/m2 daily

options.label: C
options.text: Alkalinization of the urine by administration of NaHCO3

options.label: D
options.text: Frequent monitoring of serum chemistries every 4 hours

questions.correct_answer: C. Alkalinization of the urine by administration of NaHCO3

questions.text: An 80-year-old man is investigated for progressive cognitive impairment. Which one of the following features is most suggestive of Lewy body dementia?

A 68-year-old gentleman is brought into your ER after a syncope. The monitor showed a HR of 190 bpm with a BP of 85/50mmHg. His SpO2 is 98% (on NRBM). ECG shows a regular wide complex tachycardia with no apparent P waves. With regard to the JVP waveform, which of these features would you expect to see?

You are attending a skill based training program on shoulder dystocia. When the situation shown below is encountered, the first thing done is McRobert’s maneuver and supra pubic pressure. If this fails, what is the next best step?

A 55-year-old male presents with new-onset seizures, progressive headaches, and focal neurological deficits. MRI of the brain reveals a large, irregular mass with central necrosis and ring enhancement in the right cerebral hemisphere. A biopsy is performed, and the histopathological image is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 55-year-old male patient with a history of hyperlipidemia was started on statins for elevated triglyceride levels. Despite the statin therapy, his triglyceride levels remain persistently elevated at over 600 mg/dL. Which of the following medications should be administered next to help manage his triglyceride levels? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Gemfibrozil

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For patients with significantly elevated triglyceride levels (over 600 mg/dL) that do not respond adequately to statins, fibrates like gemfibrozil are the next step in management to reduce the risk of pancreatitis.

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy presents to emergency with a fainting episode during playing football. Blood examination reveals hypoglycemia, raised levels of ketone bodies, lactic acid & trigylcerides. On examination, liver & kidneys were enlarged. Histopathology of liver shows excess deposits of normally formed glycogen. What is the diagnosis?

On physical examination, the boy exhibits tenderness in the perianal region. A sample from the perianal area is collected and subjected to a specific test, resulting in the formation of yellow needle shaped crystals of spermine phosphate. What is the test performed on the specimen?

There is flattening of femoral head and subchondral cysts were seen on X-ray. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 13-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with abdominal pain and is diagnosed with intussusception. During surgery, the surgeon discovers multiple polyps and sends a resected section for histopathology. Based on the image provided, what is the most likely type of lesion?

A 14y girl is brought by her anxious mother in the OPD. She is worried that her daughter has not yet attained menarche. On history, you note that the girl is in grade 9, doing well in studies and is on the school’s basketball team. On examination you find there is no breast development and no pubic or axillary hair. The external genitalia appear normal. An ultrasound shows a small uterus. FSH is ordered which is 40. A karyotype is done which is 46XY. What is the diagnosis?

On examination, you note conjunctivitis and suspect measles. Which of the following statements regarding measles is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Measles has a high secondary attack rate.

options.label: B
options.text: Only one serotype of the measles virus is responsible for infection.

options.label: C
options.text: Measles is not infectious during the prodromal stage.

options.label: D
options.text: Infection with measles virus confers lifelong immunity.

questions.correct_answer: C. Measles is not infectious during the prodromal stage.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Measles is not infectious during the prodromal stage.

A 40-year-old man with treatment-resistant schizophrenia has been on clozapine for the past six months. He presents to the emergency department with a three-day history of fever, sore throat, and generalized weakness. Laboratory tests show a white blood cell count of 2,000/dL, with an absolute neutrophil count (ANC) of 800/dL. Which of the following is not true regarding the above condition?

options.label: B
options.text: It is an idiosyncratic side effect of clozapine

options.label: C
options.text: Once a week monitoring of WBC and ANC count is required in the first six months of initiation for early detection

options.label: D
options.text: Clozapine can be continued but with everyday monitoring of WBC and ANC counts

questions.correct_answer: D. Clozapine can be continued but with everyday monitoring of WBC and ANC counts
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Clozapine can be continued but with everyday monitoring of WBC and ANC counts

A couple visit the OPD. They are troubled as they have been unable to conceive and have been trying since a year. On further history, you note that the woman has regular but extremely painful periods which have been worsening over time. An HSG reveals patent tubes and the semen analysis is normal. What is the next best step?

options.label: D
options.text: Reassure and explain the fertile period

questions.text: Which of the following is the preferred drug for total intravenous anaesthesia? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Propofol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Propofol is the drug of choice for total intravenous anesthesia and day-care surgery due to its rapid onset and offset, and favorable side effect profile.

questions.text: A 32y G3P2 with previous 2 cesarean sections presents at 32 weeks. She has no current complaints and has brought an ultrasound report which says there is a single live fetus of 32 weeks. It also mentions the placenta is anterior and low lying reaching the os. What is the next best step?

A 6-year-old boy is brought to the clinic by his parents because of loud snoring and difficulty breathing during sleep. They report that he often stops breathing for a few seconds during the night and wakes up gasping for air. He has been increasingly tired during the day and has difficulty concentrating at school. Physical examination reveals enlarged tonsils. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 72-year-old man presents to the emergency department with a 3-day history of discharge, pain, and redness in his left eye. He states that his ophthalmologist surgically placed a "filter" in this eye 5 years ago to control his glaucoma. Visual acuity is 20/200 in this eye. Inspection reveals an infected and swollen eye. You also note a very milky layer of fluid accumulating in the anterior chamber as shown in the figure below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Hyperacute bacterial conjunctivitis caused by Neisseria gonorrhea

A 30y P2L2 is using Mala N as a contraceptive. She reports to you having missed taking 4 pills from Day 14-17 of the packet. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Take the 4 missed pills, continue the remaining packet, take an emergency contraceptive, use a condom for 7 days, discard the remaining iron tablets and start a new packet after completion of the hormonal tablets

options.label: B
options.text: Take the last missed pill, continue the remaining packet, take an emergency contraceptive, use a condom for 7 days, discard the remaining iron tablets and start a new packet after completion of the hormonal tablets

options.label: C
options.text: Discard the packet, start a new packet, use the emergency contraception and use a condom for 7 days

options.label: D
options.text: Take the last missed pill, continue the remaining packet, take an emergency contraceptive, use a condom for 7 days.

questions.correct_answer: B. Take the last missed pill, continue the remaining packet, take an emergency contraceptive, use a condom for 7 days, discard the remaining iron tablets and start a new packet after completion of the hormonal tablets
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Take the last missed pill, continue the remaining packet, take an emergency contraceptive, use a condom for 7 days, discard the remaining iron tablets and start a new packet after completion of the hormonal tablets

questions.text: A 34-year-old patient ABPA on chronic steroids presented to the ER with swelling and pain of left lower limb and sudden onset breathlessness. On arrival patient hemodynamically stable with shock index > 1. Compression ultrasound showed Left lower limb DVT. Which of the following tests confirms the underlying diagnosis?
A 23y woman with a history of 2 pregnancy losses is being evaluated for APLA. Which is not criteria for diagnosis APLA?

options.label: A
options.text: One or more clinical episodes of arterial, venous or small vessel thrombosis in any organ

options.label: B
options.text: One or more unexplained deaths of a morphologically normal fetus > 10 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: One or more premature births of a morphologically normal neonate at or before 30 weeks sure to preeclampsia/ eclampsia or placental insufficiency

options.label: D
options.text: Three or more unexplained consecutive spontaneous abortions before the 10th week of pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: C. One or more premature births of a morphologically normal neonate at or before 30 weeks sure to preeclampsia/ eclampsia or placental insufficiency
questions.explanation: Ans. C) One or more premature births of a morphologically normal neonate at or before 30 weeks sure to preeclampsia/ eclampsia or placental insufficiency

questions.text: Swansea criteria is used to diagnose:
questions.correct_answer: A. Acute fatty liver of pregnancy
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Acute fatty liver of pregnancy

questions.text: A 36y P2L2 presents to the OPD with complaints of a vaginal mass since few months. It worsens on standing and straining. On examination this is seen. What is the best management option?
A patient is undergoing treatment for cancer with methotrexate. What is the mechanism of action? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Inhibits dihydrofolic acid reductase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methotrexate is an antimetabolite drug that inhibits dihydrofolic acid reductase, an enzyme crucial for DNA synthesis. This mechanism disrupts cell division, making it effective in treating cancer.

questions.text: A 32-year-old female health worker is preparing for a community outreach event in a rural area of Uttar Pradesh. As part of her preparation, she is reviewing the components of the Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn, Child and Adolescent Health (RMNCAH) initiatives, more popularly known in India as the Reproductive and Child Health (RCH) program. She notes that the program includes various components to improve the health of mothers and children. Which of the following is NOT typically recognized as a primary component of the RCH program?

options.label: C
options.text: Screening and treatment for STI and RTI

questions.text: A patient is set for total hip replacement surgery, and as part of the preoperative preparation, a venous line is inserted in the anatomical snuff box on the left wrist. Evaluate the following statements regarding this venous access point and identify the incorrect one:

options.label: A
options.text: It terminates directly into the axillary vein

options.label: B
options.text: In the arm, the cephalic vein lies along the lateral side of the biceps brachii

options.label: C
options.text: In the Deltopectoral Groove, it is accompanied by the pectoral branch of the thoraco-acromial artery

options.label: D
options.text: The cephalic vein lies in the roof of the anatomical snuff box

questions.correct_answer: C. In the Deltopectoral Groove, it is accompanied by the pectoral branch of the thoraco-acromial artery
questions.explanation: Ans. C) In the Deltopectoral Groove, it is accompanied by the pectoral branch of the thoraco-acromial artery

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman undergoing a scheduled cesarean section suddenly becomes hypotensive, bradycardic, and exhibits respiratory distress shortly after the administration of spinal anesthesia. The patient also reports difficulty breathing and her level of consciousness begins to decrease. On examination, she has dilated pupils and weak peripheral pulses. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 47-year-old patient undergoes a biopsy, and the pathology report describes a "cell-in-cell" appearance. Which phenomenon is this appearance associated with?

A 25-year-old male was brought to the emergency department after being struck on his head by the house door and temporarily fainting. On examination, his sensorium was intact. NCCT head was performed and study was normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old man was found unresponsive near an electrical substation and was brought to the emergency department. The image shows the burn pattern on his arm. What specific condition most likely leads to the formation of this burn?

options.label: A
options.text: Loose contact with low voltage current

options.label: B
options.text: Firm contact with low voltage current

options.label: C
options.text: Loose contact with high voltage current

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: C. Loose contact with high voltage current

questions.text: A 25-year-old patient diagnosed with absence seizures is being treated with ethosuximide. What is the mechanism of action of ethosuximide? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Inhibit T-type calcium channels

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ethosuximide controls absence seizures by specifically inhibiting T-type calcium channels, reducing the abnormal firing patterns in the thalamus that cause these seizures.

questions.text: A 40-year-old patient undergoing treatment for tuberculosis reports experiencing a decrease in visual acuity and color blindness. Which of the following antitubercular drugs is most likely to cause visual problems? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ethambutol is an antitubercular drug that can cause optic neuritis, leading to a decrease in visual acuity and red-green color blindness.

questions.text: A 58-year-old hypertensive patient with a history of myocardial infarction (MI) presents with an acute attack of migraine. Which of the following medications should not be given for migraine in this patient? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Sumatriptan

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Triptans, such as sumatriptan & ergotamine, are contraindicated in patients with a history of myocardial infarction or other significant cardiovascular diseases due to their potential to cause coronary artery vasoconstriction

questions.explanation: Ans. C) A-2, B-3, C-4, D-1, E-5

A cohort study investigates the association between fizzy drinks consumption and the risk of developing Diabetes mellitus. The relative risk (RR) was found to be 1.85. Based on this information, which of the following statements is correct regarding the association between fizzy drinks intake and diabetes mellitus?

options.label: A
options.text: Fizzy drinks consumption increases the risk of diabetes mellitus.

options.label: B
options.text: Fizzy drinks consumption decreases the risk of diabetes mellitus.

options.label: C
options.text: F izzy drinks consumption has no effect on the risk of diabetes mellitus.

options.label: D
options.text: The association cannot be determined from this information.

questions.correct_answer: A. Fizzy drinks consumption increases the risk of diabetes mellitus.

A 45-year-old patient has just undergone surgery and requires a drug to reverse the muscle relaxation induced during the procedure. Which of the following drugs is used for this purpose? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Neostigmine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Reversal agents:
  • ➤ Neostigmine is commonly used to reverse the effects of muscle relaxants after surgery. It works by inhibiting acetylcholinesterase, increasing acetylcholine levels at the neuromuscular junction, and is combined with atropine to prevent cholinergic side effects. Sugammadex : Known as a Selective Relaxant Binding Agent (SRBA). Specifically used to reverse the effects of Rocuronium and Vecuronium. It is the fastest acting reversal agent and does not cause cholinergic side effects, eliminating the need for atropine.
  • ➤ Neostigmine is commonly used to reverse the effects of muscle relaxants after surgery. It works by inhibiting acetylcholinesterase, increasing acetylcholine levels at the neuromuscular junction, and is combined with atropine to prevent cholinergic side effects.
  • ➤ Sugammadex : Known as a Selective Relaxant Binding Agent (SRBA). Specifically used to reverse the effects of Rocuronium and Vecuronium. It is the fastest acting reversal agent and does not cause cholinergic side effects, eliminating the need for atropine.
  • ➤ Sugammadex

questions.text: A 35-year-old male patient presents to the emergency department with a high fever, severe headache, confusion, and altered level of consciousness. He has a history of recent travel to a malaria-endemic region. On examination, he is found to have signs of jaundice, anemia, and significant dehydration. His blood pressure is low, and his pulse is rapid and weak. Laboratory tests reveal severe hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenia, and elevated liver enzymes. Additionally, his urine output has significantly decreased over the past 24 hours. Blood smears confirm the presence of Plasmodium falciparum. What is the first management step in this situation? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Intravenous artesunate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In severe malaria caused by Plasmodium falciparum, the first-line treatment is intravenous artesunate, which is effective in rapidly reducing parasitemia and improving patient outcomes.

A 45-year-old male was on metronidazole therapy for a bacterial infection. He attended a party and consumed alcohol. Shortly after, he developed symptoms including intense facial flushing, severe nausea, vomiting, headache, dizziness, palpitations, and hypotension. What is the likely cause? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Drug interaction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Metronidazole can cause a disulfiram-like reaction when combined with alcohol, leading to the accumulation of acetaldehyde and subsequent unpleasant symptoms.

A 72-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a chief complaint of a sudden onset of severe pain in his right eye, accompanied by blurred vision that started approximately two days ago. He also reports seeing halos around lights and experiencing a significant decrease in visual acuity. His medical history is significant for hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus, both of which are well-controlled with medication. He has no prior history of ocular trauma or surgery. On physical examination, the following findings are noted: ⁠ Visual acuity: Right eye (OD) 20/200, Left eye (OS) 20/40 ⁠ Intraocular pressure (IOP): Right eye (OD) 45 mmHg, Left eye (OS) 16 mmHg ⁠ Slit-lamp examination: Conjunctival injection in the right eye Corneal edema and a shallow anterior chamber in the right eye A dense, white cataract in the right eye Presence of a significant number of white, particulate matter in the anterior chamber ⁠ Fundoscopic examination Optic disc and retina details are difficult to visualize in the right eye due to the cataract and corneal edema Laboratory Results Basic blood workup including complete blood count, electrolytes, and blood glucose levels are within normal limits. What is the definitive treatment options for this condition?

options.label: D
options.text: Wait and Watch for spontaneous resolution

questions.text: A senior cardiologist discusses a congenital heart defect with residents, focusing on a developmental anomaly due to anterior displacement of the cono-truncal septum, which causes an unequal division of the conus cordis. Which condition is associated with this defect?
